title: Bangalore (India) ping has increased again.
body:
Hello Everyone,

I am from Bangalore (India), very recently I believe the ping increased again for NA server. Before it used to be 218 (Act Broadband), now its around 256-260 something. Over the span of 1 - 1.5 years the ping increased has been steadily increasing from 160 to 180 something then 200 , then 218 and now its 256-260. 

I checked with ISP, doesn't seems to be an issue with them.

I generally play on Na server, Cuz of English speaking community. I tried other servers, but they usually converse in their own languages and when you talk in English, they start flaming. Pretty hard to play on other regional servers.  I don't want to blame the community but another reason would be, I started on NA and would prefer to stay there. Lots of my friends play on NA server as well.

Hopefully this message reaches to people from my region. 

I wanted to know, what ping you guys are getting ? Please do name your ISP as well your region in India.

Like for example Airtel, etc.

Or in case you believe I am the only Victim of high ping here in Bangalore. Do enlighten me. Let me know if I can shift to some other better ISP.

It seems on CMD ping I am getting 246-247, but on client its showing 256-270. I know client doesn't used ICMPL. But still it's quite unstable.

For one thing I know, I have been playing other online games as well, their Ping haven't increased in ages, one game I have been playing for 4 year's now it used to be 180 now it's somewhat around 166 or something, to be honest more like they have improved over the span of time, all of these games are hosted in America.

Seems like riot has made enemy out of quite a few Internet hosting companies or I don't know how its working out to be honest, I am not pretty good when it come to networking, but I understand the basics pretty well and can troubleshoot some issues from my end.

replies.body:
It definitely looks like your connection spikes after reaching Zayo's network. Since your ISP partners with them in order to get your connection to the NA servers, you'll likely need to reach out to them with those traceroutes to have them investigate. If you'd like to have one of our tech team members take a look at your network configuration to ensure there's nothing else that could impact your connection, [submit a ticket.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new)

With your ticket, include the traceroute you pasted here, along with a set of logs using our [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs). Let me know if you have any questions.

Is it possible for riot to reach out to Zayo ? My ISP refuses to get in touch with zayo, they say that they only control till the first 5 hops, then the rest goes out of their reach.

I tried emailing them, with my trace result and I definitely doubt they will help a total stranger with 0 obligation and no connection's with. But if a big company like riot's member reaches out to them, my hope will probably increase from 0% to 50% hopefully, awaiting a reply.

Unfortunately, as we're not a direct customer of Zayo, they would be equally unwilling to work with us. Since your ISP directly partners with them to access their backbone networks, they'll have to be the ones to reach out to Zayo about the routing inconsistencies. 

I strongly recommend reaching out to our tech specialists in a ticket, as they'll be able to provide you the exact context and data necessary to work with your ISP on a permanent fix on this. 

Let me know if you have any further questions.
